title: Electric potential - rank V1 V2 V3 in a triangle

content.question: Three charged particles are fixed in place at the vertices of an equilateral triangle of side length <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. The particles have the charge values indicated. Points <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> are each located at the midpoint of a side of the triangle, and Point <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is equidistant from all three particles. Which of the following correctly ranks the electric potentials <math alttext="V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="V sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> at points <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="P sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="V sub 1 equals V sub 2, which equals V sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub 1 is greater than V sub 2, which is greater than V sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub 2 is greater than V sub 3, which is greater than V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V sub 3 is greater than V sub 2, which is greater than V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="V sub 3 is greater than V sub 2, which is greater than V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
